conclusion: To determine the car's acceleration from the start of timing, we need to analyze the given x-t (position-time) graph.
The graph shows the relationship between the position x and time t.
The slope of the x-t graph gives the velocity v of the car.
The acceleration a can be found from the velocity-time graph, which is the derivative of the position-time graph.
The x-t graph is a straight line passing through the origin.
This indicates that the velocity is constant.
The slope of the line is the velocity v.
The slope of the line in the x-t graph is the change in position divided by the change in time.
From the graph, we can see that the slope is 10 m/s for the positive part and -10 m/s for the negative part.
The slope of the line is the velocity, so v = 10 m/s for the positive part and v = -10 m/s for the negative part.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity.
Since the velocity is changing linearly with time, the acceleration is the slope of the velocity-time graph.
From the graph, we can see that the slope of the velocity-time graph is the change in velocity divided by the change in time.
The slope of the line is the change in velocity divided by the change in time, which is (10 - (-10))/(0 - (-2)) = 20/2 = 10 m/s².
Therefore, the car's acceleration from the start of timing is 10 m/s².
